EFL TIME TO BAY Bayern Munich sued for £100,000 by fan after being crushed by Manchester United supporter who jumped off turnstile 
Fritz Rettensteiner still needs a walking stick through injuries suffered prior to 2014 Champions League clash By Gary Stonehouse 24th March 2017, 12:21 pm Updated: 24th March 2017, 12:21 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A FOOTBALL fan that was left needing a walking stick courtesy of a Manchester United supporter is in a legal battle with Bayern Munich. 
Fritz Rettensteiner was at the Allianz Arena for the Champions League quarter-final between the two European giants when the traumatic incident occurred in 2014. Reuters 4 A Bayern Munich supporter is suing the club for £100k after a Manchester United fan left him with severe injuries prior to a 2014 Champions League clash 
Bayern would defeat United 3-1 (4-2 on aggregate), but the Austrian missed out on the clash after a ticketless United fan jumped the barrier and crashed into him. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest FOOTBALL gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Rettensteiner was rushed straight to hospital with a fractured kneecap, elbow and a lost tooth after being crushed to the ground, according to Suddeutsche Zeitung . 
The injuries he suffered were so bad that he requires the use of a walking stick still – three years after the incident. 
Even though the Red Devils follower was caught and had his details taken, he is unlikely to be held accountable for his actions by the authorities. Therefore, Rettensteiner is suing Bayern for £103,385 – insisting that the club failed to put in place appropriate safety measures to prevent the accident from occurring. 
The estate agent’s lawyers told a Munich court on Wednesday that tall turnstiles or a ticket check would have stopped the incident. 
However, Bayern argued their case back, insisted out of the two million fans that pass through their gates each year only four or five of them jump the barriers. Getty Images David Moyes was in charge of Manchester United for their 3-1 defeat at Bayern Munich Getty Images Former Chelsea star Arjen Robben was one of the goalscorers for Bayern Munich against Manchester United Getty Images 4 Mario Mandzukic celebrates his goal after netting against Manchester United 
Bild reported that the Bundesliga club’s lawyer Gerhard Riedl said: “The Allianz Arena is one of the safest stadiums in the world. 
“There is no security risk, this was a regrettable accident.” Bayern Munich football stars visit the famous beer festival Oktoberfest 
Despite these claims, Bayern did admit that games against United are deemed “high risk” and additional ticket checks should have been conducted – something they could not confirm took place on night in question. 
The case will continue on Wednesday April 5 after the judge’s comprised payment offer of £8,609 was rejected by both parties.
